page.title: 05Peaks Lane fire station.
page.content: The fire station in{Peaks Lane {Grimsby,}was built in{l965}as the headquarters for the then{Grimsby {County Borough Fire Brigade.}It replaced two older fire stations in the town. It was the{first}fire station in{Britain}to be able to {control}the{traffic lights}outside the station, when fire appliances turned out. Today it is station{C1}in the {Humberside Fire Brigade,}and is the {Divisional Headquarters.}The station is manned 24 hours a day by{25}full time firemen, who ride{four}fire appliances,{three pumps}and a {100'turntable ladder.}Fire appliances from this fire station turn out to approximately{1,500}incidents each year.
